pages.text: Quetzalcoatlus was a giant pterosaur from the Late Cretaceous of North America. It had a long, slender neck and tail, and a wingspan of up to 12 meters. Quetzalcoatlus was a powerful flyer, using its long wings to glide and hunt for fish and other prey.
Imagine a giraffe got bitten by a radioactive plane - that's basically what this absolute unit was
